intro: Dipteracanthus jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican starflower, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the Caribbean. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and its stems are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
